BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE LAW FOUNDATION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI - KANSAS CITY LAW SCHOOL
IRS990.MissionDesc: SUPPORT OF UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI - KANSAS CITY LAW SCHOOL
IRS990.Desc: LAW SCHOOL SUPPORT THROUGH STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, AWARDS, STUDENT COMPETITIONS, AND SUPPORT OF COMMENCEMENT CEREMONIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: LAW LIBRARY AND FACILITIES SUPPORT THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF BOOKS AND RELATED EQUIPMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: FACULTY SUPPORT SERVICES THROUGH LECTURES, MEETING, AND TRAINING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY-SUPPORTED ENTITY WHICH IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE FOUNDATION HAS ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE FASB ASC 740-10 AS IT MIGHT APPLY TO THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS. THE FOUNDATION'S POLICY IS TO RECORD A LIABILITY FOR ANY TAX POSITION THAT IS BENEFICIAL TO THE FOUNDATION, INCLUDING ANY RELATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES, WHEN IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THE POSITION TAKEN BY MANAGEMENT WITH RESPECT TO THE TRANSACTION OR CLASS OF TRANSACTIONS WILL BE OVERTURNED BY A TAXING AUTHORITY UPON EXAMINATION. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THERE ARE NO SUCH POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO LIABILITY HAS BEEN ACCRUED. FEDERAL FORM 990 HAS BEEN FILED IN A TIMELY MANNER.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES RECLASSED AGAINST INCOME 41,328.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES RECLASSED AGAINST INCOME 41,328.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: GENERAL SUPPORT TO THE UMKC SCHOOL OF LAW BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS THROUGH AWARDS, STUDENT COMPETITIONS, AND SUPPORT OF COMMENCEMENT CEREMONIES. ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO THE LAW LIBRARY THORUGH THE PURCHASE OF BOOKS AND RELATED EQUIPMENT. FINALLY, ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO THE FACULTY THROUGH LECTURES, MEETINGS, AND TRAINING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DEAN OF STUDENT SERVICES REQUESTS FROM THE LAW FOUNDATION A REPORT INDICATING AN ESTIMATE OF SCHOLARSHIP MONIES AVAILABLE FROM EACH FUND. THE DEAN OF STUDENTS SERVICES IS WELL INFORMED OF EACH STUDENTS ACADEMIC AND FINANCIAL BACKGROUND. THEREFORE THE LAW FOUNDATION HAS GIVEN THE DEAN OF THE LAW SCHOOL THE DUTY OF AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS EACH YEAR. IF THE DEAN OF THE LAW SCHOOL DEEMS IT HELPFUL OR NECESSARY, SHE MAY REQUEST ASSISTANCE FROM THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE. AFTER THE DEAN OF THE LAW SCHOOL DETERMINES WHO SHOULD RECEIVE A SCHOLARSHIP, THE PROPOSED RECIPIENTS ARE SENT A LETTER OF ACCEPTANCE OR REJECTION. ONCE ACCEPTED, THE NAMES ARE ENTERED INTO THE FINANCIAL AID DATABASE AND THE SCHOLARSHIP ARE CHARGED TO THE LAW FOUNDATIONS AGENCY ACCOUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHRIS HOYT AND RAFE FOREMAN ARE CO-WORKERS AT THE UMKC SCHOOL SCHOOL OF LAW THE HONORABLE STEPHEN BOUGH, JULIA KITSMILLER, AND LAJUANA COUNTS ARE CO-WORKERS AT THE US COURTHOUSE - JACKSON COUNTY, MO. LISA WEIXELMAN AND WILLIAM PRUGH (RETIRED) ARE CO-WORKERS AT POLSINELLI PC. MIKE ALBANO AND CHRISTINE ALBANO ARE FATHER - DAUGHTER. STEVE BURMEISTER AND BRETT BURMEISTER ARE FATHER - SON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROPERTIES, BUSINESS AFFAIRS, AND ACTIVITIES OF THE FOUNDATION SHALL BE MANAGED BY A BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WHICH SHALL HAVE PLENARY POWER IN THE CONTROL OF ALL MATTERS. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO CARRY OUT ALL LAWFUL FUNCTIONS THAT ARE PERMITTED BY THE BYLAWS AND THE FOUNDATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VACANCIES AMONG THE TRUSTEES RESULTING FROM THE DEATH, RESIGNATION, INCAPACITY, REMOVAL, OR DISQUALIFICATION FOR ANY REASON, OR BY REASON OF AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF TRUSTEES MAY BE FILLED BY A MAJORITY OF THE VOTING TRUSTEES REMAINING IN OFFICE. A TRUSTEE SO ELECTED TO FILL A VACANCY SHALL SERVE FOR THE UNEXPIRED TERM OF HIS/HER PREDECESSOR AND UNTIL HIS/HER SUCCESSOR SHALL HAVE BEEN DULLY APPOINTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE SHALL BE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF THE EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE FOUNDATION AND TWO ADDITIONAL VOTING TRUSTEES TO EXERCISE ALL OF THE POWERS OF THE BOARD IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE FOUNDATION'S AFFAIRS IN THE INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ACT FOR THE BOARD ON ALL MATTERS EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING, WHICH SHALL BE RESERVED FOR THE BOARD (A) TRUSTEE AND OFFICER; ELECTION (B) ADOPTION OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET; (C) CREATION OF ADDITIONAL STANDING COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD; (D) ELECTION OR APPOINTMENT OF MEMBERS OF THE BOARD TO SERVE ON ALL STANDING COMMITTEES; (E) NAMING EMERITUS TRUSTEES AND HONORARY TRUSTEES; (F) CHANGES IN INSTITUTIONAL MISSION AND PURPOSES; (G) CHANGES TO THE ARTICLES AND/OR BYLAWS; (H) INCURRING OF CORPORATE INDEBTEDNESS; (I) SALE OF FOUNDATION ASSETS OR TANGIBLE PROPERTY; AND (J) THOSE CORPORATE POWERS AND MATTERS REQUIRED BY THE ARTICLES, THESE BYLAWS OR BY LAW TO BE EXERCISED OR UNDERTAKEN SOLELY BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESOURCE COMMITTEE AND THE LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY DISCUSSED AND REVIEWED AT THE ANNUAL BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FROM TOM GREEN AT 816-235-1646.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST FROM TOM GREEN AT 816-235-1646.
